Reviews.Title: “Back a second time - comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: dbtravel_boston
Reviews.Content: I recently returned to Hotel De La Paix and it was just as comfortable and convenient as the last time. I had a different room (in the front and on the top floor) and it was smaller than the room I stayed in last time (at the back and on a lower floor), but it was still comfortable. It was great as a single. Plenty of hot water, clean, easy to get around Paris from here but a little removed from the main tourist crush. The breakfast cost extra, but was delicious (pain chocolat, croissant, and baguette) and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: Taheg
Reviews.Content: Me, my sister and our friend stayed at this charming boutique hotel for three nights. We had the superior suite on the fifth floor, it has a lovely ambience - nicely decorated and comfy beds. The staff are very helpful, my sister left her bracelet and rang to ask if they could return to her, which they did. Our favourite member of staff was Meyer who greeted us every night, and was so helpful and kind to us. We are definitely going to return, and thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay, in this great city. J'aime Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Julie M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon in France and Rome. In France, we stayed at this wonderful hotel! We can not say enough great things about how wonderful our stay was! So close to the Metro and close to cafes and of course, we walked to the gardens! The staff helped us every day and night with recommendations, directions and translation (neither one of us speak French). The room was perfect, the bathroom was clean and provided wonderful soaps. THANK YOU HOTEL DE LA PAIX! And I HIGHLY recommend the cafe/restaurant across the street, we ate there every night and enjoyed the quiet street, it was picture perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Price!!”
Reviews.Author: Matty1892
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on this site, and we were not disappointed. We stayed 3 nights, travelling from Charles de Gaulle Airport on the Metro to Denfert Rochereau station, which took us about 45 mins, then a 10 min walk from the station to the hotel. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The hotel is a short walk from two Metro stations with links to all of the main tourist destinations. It is also a 5 minute walk from Tour Montparnasse, which is definitely worth a visit for the spectacular views! The famous cemetery and Catacombs are also in short walking distance. Overall I can not fault the Hotel and will definitely be staying again when returning to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Krone9186
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend in Paris. The location was excellent, right next to an RER stop which made transferring to the airport efficient and less expensive. In addition, the location to the metro was very convenient. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff was polite. As a female I found the lighting in the main room a bit dim. The bathroom lights were a little difficult for putting makeup on. I suggest bringing a travel mirror with a light. I found myself asking if I looked like a clown once I got outside. Otherwise, definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great find, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: SisKish
Reviews.Content: What a great find, walking distance to the Gare de Montparnasse and a friend's apartment in the 14th. A Métro stop is right outside the door too. The rooms are newly refurnished and nicely decorated. The two weekends that I stayed (to and from Saint Malo) the elevator was not working as it was going to be updated and I was given a nice discount. The staff was super friendly and the wifi was free and worked at all times. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in expensive Paris”
Reviews.Author: smallgroupsonly
Reviews.Content: Boutique Parisian hotel in great location very close to Metro stop. Lovely neighborhood w/many cafes/restaurants within easy waking distance. Matter of fact we opted not to pay for the 9 Euro/day breakfast per person which consisted of coffee juice and rolls for the cafes close by. Stayed on 4th floor very quiet and plenty of room in the twin room.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Price - the best in pricey Paris...”
Reviews.Author: jetsetMar
Reviews.Content: As a solo traveler, this was my first time to Paris. As a big city with many hotel options, my choice to stay at this hotel was a suitable one considering travel time and budget especially since I went for New Years. I stayed in a single room. For some it would be considered very small but in my head since I’ve cruised many times, the size is comparable to a room on a cruise ship. The room was adorable and very comfortable for just me. My room was toward the back so street noise was not an issue. Sometimes I would hear the early risers (hard core tourists) in the morning but that’s my fault for snoozing in late in the morning. The bathroom was a good size but the shower was tiny. The staff were extremely friendly. They greeted me all the time and provided great restaurant recommendations as well as helped with overall directions and city suggestions. Location couldn’t be more ideal as least in the mindset of getting around the city – literally in the center of Montparnasse. The building was two blocks away – just look up. We all wish to be staying on the Champs Elysses (too expensive to do so) but with easy Metro access literally one block away was great. The Raspail metro has 4 & 6 lines which took me directly to the Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triomphe, Notre Dame, and more. After a while, I didn’t need my map cause it was easy to navigate throughout the city. (tip: purchase a booklet of 10 carnets and keep in pocket – makes it easy to go in and out without always being in line to buy a ticket.) Walk 10 minutes and you’ll have access to Rer B which took me directly from airport and to Gare Nord train station (for Amsterdam). If you walk up on Raspail Blvd towards the direction of the Siene, you’ll find many restaurants, St. Germaine area and a visit to the Le Grande Epicurean at Bon Marche is a must. Walk the other direction and you’ll find the entrance to the underground catacombs, Paul (bakery yum) and other good places to eat near the Defense. Overall, this boutique hotel met my expectations, I was very pleased with my stay and I totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, cute and boutiquey”
Reviews.Author: RNG1974
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel! I stayed with my other half last weekend, a total of two nights. We got a superior (larger!) room after reading other reviews on here; it was on the 2nd floor and contrary to some of the other reviews on here we didn't bother with the lift, the stairs were really not a problem even with luggage. The room was, of course, not huge. Paris is mostly old buildings and you won't get masses of space anywhere unless you're paying hundreds of euros per night. Its best to just plan to have no space in your room, pack lightly if you can or ask the hotel to stash some of your luggage downstairs to keep it out of your way. As per some of the other reviews, my 6ft 4 200 lb boyf found the shower small. I found this tres amusing. We had the breakfast both days, out of pure laziness and not wanting to rush around. Its 9 euros per person and bearing in mind you're pretty much going to pay 5 euros for a coffee anywhere in Paris its about the right price. You could pay more, you could pay less. It was worth it, totally French and very nice indeed. The best two things about Le Hotel de la Paix for me were the quietness and the location. There was no noise at all, I had no trouble sleeping. This is a good thing for Paris, it can be very noisy. The location was on 2 metro lines so you could hop on outside and get anywhere very easily. I wanted to do two things - the Grand Epicery de Bon Marche (French Whole Foods, woo!) and the Eiffel Tower. The Grand Epicery was a 15 min walk and the Eiffel Tower was 4 metro stops with no changes. You can easily walk up, through the Jardin de Luxembourg, to St Germain de Pres and all the nice places to eat and shop in that area. Around there are also some bars which show sport (this was important to my boyfriend; look for Rue Princesse near metro stop Mabillion and try Eden Park or the Frog and Princess). Both sides of the Bvd St Germain have shops, cafes, restaurants on cute little streets. This is what Paris should look like!! Additionally the RER B train from the airport stopped at Port Royale which was a 10 min walk from the hotel, and the train journey took about 45 mins. Its much easier than driving or being driven. I can't fault the hotel, it was clean, quiet, petite in a nice way and the staff were very pleasant and helpful. Would recommend highly!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Milan M
Reviews.Content: Stayed with the family (2 young kids), room was ready when we arrived before schedule. English speaking staff helped a lot, clean room but a bit small buy hey this is paris :-) AMAZING location! I repeat AMAZING location! safe with a lot of restaurants near by.

Reviews.Title: “Good buy”
Reviews.Author: ryokogasuki
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in late December and early January for a total of 3 nights. Some observations: RER stop from CDG Airport: 600-700 meters Metro: About 50 meters Heat/TV: Very good Elevator: Very small but romantic! Front office: Excellent service Bathroom: Good size and very clean Rooms: Small but clean Noise: Did not notice any problem Breakfast: Additional, 9 Euro Cancellation: 48 hr notice Safe area with many restaurants Overall: Very good buy for Paris for 99 Euro we paid for a std room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnaConda27
Reviews.Content: I absolutely adored this hotel! The location is great, just steps away from the Raspail Metro stop, which is on 2 different lines. The staff was wonderful...very patient and helpful and their English was easy to understand. They even arranged for a shuttle to take me to the airport. The room was just lovely, I loved how each room is decorated in a different way. There are lots of restaurants and shops nearby, including a great patisserie at the end of the block (I can't remember the name). I would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: okum0003
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful experience here with my husband. The hotel lobby is incredibly charming, the rooms are simple but charming as well. I think we may have been upgraded to one of the larger rooms but be aware the rooms are still small by US standards. This was expected and not a problem since we spent the majority of time off in the city. It was located a block away from the metro and very near the Luxemburg park where we spent time enjoying some reading in the sun and a picnic. Many cafes and small retail shops are also nearby. The staff was helpful and friendly and the room was clean and well maintained. A great choice in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and personal.”
Reviews.Author: 30090Laura_S
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, but realize this hotel is on the far side of the airport. A taxi to the airport cost over 50 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: rsaun00
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hotel De La Paix was excellent....very friendly and helpful. The rooms are small - but we spent most of our time seeing the city. Great location - at the top of the Metro stairs you can see the hotel. Plenty of excellent restaurants nearby....the hop on hop off is practically right outside the door. We would certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: musicbox_85
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay when I was in Paris. Loads of fantastic restaurants nearby. Safe area. Clean rooms. Only complaint was perhaps the small shower but it's Paris... Right?

Reviews.Title: “Could not have had a better experience.”
Reviews.Author: dcindy
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. Not because it is super-luxurious, but because the staff are so incredible. My husband injured himself on the way in from the airport and later decided he really had to see a doctor. Danielle at the front desk spend literally hours getting him an appointment (for a house call!), and more hours later scheduling the X-ray the doctor recommended. The whole staff demonstrated genuine concern for his well-being. We left for a week in London, and the hotel happily stored our very large bags. Every member of the staff was warm and couild not do enough to be helpful to guests. Breakfast was great. Renovations were being done while we were there, but were scheduled to have minimal impact on guests. The rooms truly are soundproofed. As mentioned by other reviewers, the location could not have been better, and was the perfect combination of neighborhood Paris with plenty to see and do close by, if desired. Unlike some small hotels in Paris, this one has an elevator. I will definitely enjoy returning to this very special place.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: emily84London
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother for three nights in November. The staff were helpful and friendly, the The reception area is different in a good way and although I didn't eat breakfast the dining area was very nice. The room itself was fairly small (but then in Paris this is usually the case) and I was pleasantly surprised by the modern and clean bathroom and decor. The room was also very warm which is good in the cold though we opened the balconette window for some air. Overall this is a great place to stay and I would definitely recommend to a friend and will probably go back myself. The location is great too, the nearest tube stop is Raspail with Vavin at the other end of the road. You can walk to St Germain area and Boulevard Montparnasse is less than five minutes at the end of the road. I would give this five but I think I may reserve that for if I ever stay at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jennie7
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying here. The hotel is about 300 metres from Raspail metro station so it's really easy to get to on Metro line 4 from Gare du Nord (handy for Eurostar passengers). The room was small but clean and well-equipped and the staff were efficient and friendly - the lady who serves breakfast is the smiliest Parisienne I've ever come across! We booked a 3-night deal on the Internet and the reduced price made it very reasonable for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place ~ good location ~ reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: BN712
Reviews.Content: A charming boutique hotel. Well maintained. Room and bathroom were small (per usual in Paris) but comfortable and clean. Service was friendly. Free wifi is always appreciated. Located in a relatively quiet neighborhood, but very convenient. The subway stop is just steps away, and it only took about 10-15 minutes by subway to go to popular destinations for sightseeing, shopping and dining. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: triskank
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Hotel de la Paix. It's located very near the vibrant Blvd Montparnasse. Loads of great restaurants and nightlife. The room wasn't large or fancy but it was clean and quiet. Even on busy Blvd Raspail, the windows shut out all noise - great on a busy Saturday night. The front desk staff was helpful and friendly. I consider it to be a great value for the price (around 100 Euro per night.)

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in an expensive Paris”
Reviews.Author: ashboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the De La Paix for 03 nights in the third week of October'2011. Allow me to present a clinical overview of the hotel:- a. the staff at the reception was always very helpful at all times, the check-in was smooth b. the hotel just might have the smallest lift under operation in a commercial establishment; infact they should apply to the gunniess record book for a place. c. Our room was on the 7th floor with one double bed and crib for our child, the view is nothing to report for d. the room is extremely small (smallest I have ever stayed in paris - this was my 5th visit to Paris) e. The bathroom was small but funtional- did not miss anything f. the walls of the rooms are thin and you can actaully hear your neighbours if they are the vocal variety g. the breakfast was avaialble at an additional charge, we never tried it and used to walk down to the Montparnasse square to have our breakfast. h. Montparnasse is a very convinient walk so is the Rapsail metro station i. the bus-stop is very close by and I would highly reccomend the bus for the first time visitor to paris as it allows you to absorb the sights and sounds of the fabulos city j. the hotel would happily let you use their cloak room, infact we use to leave the pram of our child at the recption since the room was so small that the pram would just not fit the room even if braved it thru the elevator k. a couple of good pastry shops and foods store in close proximity l. room cleanliness on a daily basis was nothing great. Verdict ; i would tr a different hotel next time around, for the price of Euro140-00 a night, i would try and explore more options

Reviews.Title: “It will do”
Reviews.Author: lmisch
Reviews.Content: I wasn't terribly disappointed or thrilled with this hotel. I've been to Paris many times now (lived there for several months at one point) and I prefer to stay as close as possible to the St. Germain area just south of the river. Hotel prices in Paris really are quite steep, and we just didn't want to spend the extra $50+/night to get closer to our desired area. The Hotel De La Paix is conveniently located near metro (Raspail) and not far (by metro of on foot) from Denfert Rochereau where the RER B will take you to CDG airport. The staff was friendly and the wifi was free. The breakfast is standard fare (tartines, croissants, pain au chocolat, and a hot beverage. They have a la carte items if you want something else). The room was teeny tiny (not unexpected in europe) and seemed a little musty and dusty. The bathroom was small, but functional and clean. This hotel gets the job done, but I think the little cramped, dusty room was kind of hard on my older traveling partner. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and people my age who are looking to get out and explore Paris (people who aren't too worried about the comfort of this room, because all you do is sleep there right?). Overall, this place isn't bad at all and it's cheaper than staying right in the heart of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Very very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: yaytofu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before flying out. It was clean, in a lovely location, and affordable, all things that we needed. However, I will say, as a New Yorker and as someone who has stayed in other places in Paris, that this room (we had the cheapest double) was really really tiny. We are not necessarily used to big rooms, but there was basically an arm span worth of space on either side of the bed! And the bathroom was definitely super tiny. It was perfect for us, but I am not sure how I would feel about staying in the small double for more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: GaryBuck
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in mid-September for 3 nights based on the trip advisor recommendations. This is indeed a very nice small hotel in a quieter part of the city, with a friendly and helpful staff, giving good recommendations for touring and for dinner. The room is nicely appointed but small. Please note that the elevator is tiny, holds up to 2 ppl. Within a minutes walk from the Raspail metro, gets you anywhere you need to go in Paris. Short walk to the Saturday market on Edgar Quinet, an excellent farmer's market. Had dinner at Chez Fernand based on hotel recommendation, enjoyed it quite a bit. Rue du Montparnasse has several creperies, we ate at and enjoyed La Creperie de Josselin. Lastly, the hotel is a 10 min. walk from the RER Line B Port Royal station, so we were able to go directly from CDG airport, via RER Line B, to the hotel without transfer. Most convenient!

Reviews.Title: “great value in Paris...”
Reviews.Author: denaliboy
Reviews.Content: my wife and i decided to stay three nights at the hotel de la paix after reading an article in "the budget traveler". the renovated hotel is charming with very cool design features in the lobby and the rooms. the staff are knowledgeable and friendly. it is in a great location, close to the raspail metro station. there are excellent bakeries and restaurants within walking distance. the only problem: our room was near the stairs, so you could hear a lot of traffic of the other guests walking to and from their rooms. when we return to paris, i will ask for a different room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: keirandyl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were traveling to several different cities in Europe and I had done a lot of research on hotels prior to choosing one. Most of that research was here on tripadvisor. This was an excellent choice. The area: just a few steps from Raspail Metro. Easy access to cafe's for breakfast and dinner. Bakeries to buy lunch or even lunch fixings. There is a couple of grocery stores nearby for buying a few snacks or beverages. We didn't bother with bottled water as Paris tap water is delicious. Also walking distance to the catacombs and shopping mall. The hotel: The room was small as is the Europe standard, but it was clean and up to date. We had free wifi, private shower/toilet and a comfortable bed. The soundproofing for outside noise is great. However expect that you may hear noise from the neighbours or hallways. This didn't keep us awake or anything but if you are sensitive you might want to bring ear plugs. Elevator is teeny, enough room for your luggage, but hey with eating croissants every morning going up and down stairs worked them off. The Staff: The staff at the hotel were great. Friendly and helpful, eager to please. I would happily stay there again. Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ianseow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated very near the RER Station (Port Royal) and Metro (Raspail), has a charming cafe (cheap and good) situated diagonally opposite (Cafe Des Arts) and a friendly reception. With the exception of 2 Chambre D'Hotes we visited during our month long vacation in France, this hotel had the best service amongst the rest. We had some very good local recommendations for meals / shopping / travel from a particular receptionist, Benjamin, who understood and spoke good English. Rooms were small but that was expected. Will come back again when we're back in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: gingping
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Paris after a 2 night break with the hubby. After doing plenty of research on where to stay, I booked Hotel De La Paix.... Could not have asked for more. Upon arrival the receptionist booked us in and gave us a little run down on the local area, how to travel around and where to go. We didn't even have to ask, she offered to help us, something I've not experienced before even in luxury hotels..... Great service!! The hotel is well presented and clean, as was our room. The bed was also very comfy. It is perfectly located and easily accessible from the airport and to visit all the sites Paris has to offer. We walked to most of the main sites as we were so lucky with the weather but as Paris us quite vast you may have to use the metro if the weather is not so good. We also visited the Moulin Rouge which was well worth a visit! All in all a great trip to Paris and we would not hesitate in booking another stay at Hotel De La Paix next time we visit this charming city!!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the extra research!”
Reviews.Author: IntraVol
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Paris hotel! Upon arrival the reception knew exactly who we were and were warmly welcomed. We did our research and wanted value for money during our time in Paris. The reviews certainly did live up to expectations although initial nervous about our choice. We were not disappointed! The room was quite small but felt homely, warm and secure. It offered what a hotel bed and room should. The towels and the room were cleaned and maintained daily. Location on Bd Raspail is perfect and it close to Raspail Metro and if you're keen enough, within walking distance to the Louvre and the Eiffel Tower. Brilliant Paris charm!

Reviews.Title: “perfect 6 days!”
Reviews.Author: heidi-hon
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our First and fabulous trip to Paris. Booked this from reviews and we were so happy! Just what we needed! Awesome location, friendly staff...we loved the breakfast that got us started for our day! The room was all we needed..clean,comfortable and a great bed to collapse in after a full day! We will return!!

Reviews.Title: “Small charming hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: TeeJ_can
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for four nights - it is a very small hotel with few basic small-sized rooms and a tiny one person elevator, but these points did not take anything away from its absolute Paris charm. We had a wonderful, comfortable stay at this hotel. As soon as we entered this hotel, it felt cozy... the staff was welcoming and always helpful, the rooms were very clean, windows could be opened for some outside air, but once closed you heard nothing from the outside, completely sound proof. The view from my standard/basic room was great, giving onto the busy street in the front, but another person I was travelling with, who had one of the larger rooms, didn't have as great of a view (gave onto a cement wall a bit further away), so if view is important, maybe mention it when booking. Location is perfect!! It is a 2 min walk from a metro stop and a close by are the Jardins de Luxembourg. A quick metro ride away, you'll find: the train station, tons of great restaurants, a nice little strip with all the types of markets you could want (bakery, fishery, fruits/veggie, etc.), a grocery store and Les Catacombes. The only down side to this hotel is that the doors to the rooms are not sound proof, but the nights in the hotel were quiet. This hotel was a great find - comfortable, affordable and great location, I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dbtravel_boston
Reviews.Content: This small hotel was just outside the tourist crush but with easy access to the Metro (Raspail) and Orly Bus (Denfert). It is a short walk to the Cimitiere Montparnasse and lots of restaurants in the neighborhood. (the aligot at Le Plomb du Cantal is wonderful). It was an easy walk to the Jardin Luxembourg and the Latin Quarter. The hotel itself is basic but with a little style. The staff was helpful and it seemed very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel with lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: dolomary
Reviews.Content: This sweet hotel was our very first stop in France. We were greeted immediately by the lady I believe is the owner, who gave us lots of tourist info. Room was small, but very adequate, with French windows opening onto Blvd. Raspail. Continental breakfast was served each morning, with excellent coffee. Made friends with Ben (owner's nephew, and Maher, who was there at night). They offered lots of good advice and were absolutely wonderful people (sorry to leave them). Safe was available in the room, and there is a tiny elevator which served our purposes. Metro is on the corner, and for $50 we bought 40 tickets: note vending machines will not accept credit card without chip, so bring cash. Used tickets to travel everywhere - Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, the Louvre, Montmartre, Arc de Triomphe - all without paying cab fare. Visited different neighborhoods - do go down to St. Michel and St. Germain des Pres for restaurants, cafes, shopping, etc. There is a jazz club in St. Michel - La Caveau de la Huchette (sp?) which was wonderful - playing American bebop the night we were there (cost is about 12.5 euro per person). Hotel de la Paix was a great starting point via Metro. One block down is Avenue Montparnasse which is full of restaurants, shopping, etc. Across from the Metro on Blvd. Raspail is Montparnasse Cemetery (visited grave of Jean Seberg, Alfred Dreyfus and other greats). Don't forget to visit Pere Lachaise where Jim Morrison is buried (again, accessible by Metro).

Reviews.Title: “friendly, comfortable, clean”
Reviews.Author: littleroos
Reviews.Content: I'm always wary of giving very good reviews to reasonably priced hotels, in case I make them put their prices up!...It is conveniently located in quieter area near Montparnasse. It was clean, comfortable, staff spoke very good English and were very polite and friendly. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: pamela l
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I recently traveled to Paris and booked this hotel through Budget Travel and we were very pleased with our experience. The rooms, though a bit on the small end, are clean and modern. The hotel was quiet and the reception desk was very helpful (they even scoured google to help us find an open patisserie at 7:30pm!) We definitely recommend Hotel de la Paix. great location, great people;...lovely all around. We will be back! ps. the hotel's just blocks away from a bunch of fantastic creperies!

Reviews.Title: “As advertised- great hotel for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: bmurph74
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through Budget travel when they did a special on Paris hotels. Very affordable at about $87 Euro a night when we booked it months ahead of time. Nice, albeit small lobby if you just need to sit down for a minute. Very friendly and helpful staff that were there 24-7. We know no French, and asked a lot of questions, and they were fine with that. The room was on the small side, but I think anything at this price range will be. Who cares? It's Paris-get out there and just use the room to sleep in- that's what we did. More importantly it was CLEAN. AC controls in the room that you can adjust, and you have your own bathroom (we learned that not all hotels have both of these things) Our room also had a nice sized window which we ended up using by the end of the week. We think they cleaned our room every other day which was totally fine with us. Free WIFI- just ask them for the password- you need a password for EACH device you are connecting with though-just tell them how many you need. Easy to use safe in the room for your passports and valuables. Neighborhood that it's in is great- lots of cafes, yet quiet at night, and we definitely felt very safe coming home late at night each night. You can almost see the hotel from the Raspail stop- it's a 1-2 minute walk from the metro. CONS: the elevator is comically small. You're not getting two people and luggage in there. I found the shower to be small too. At 6', 190lbs I'm big enough to bump my elbows a lot in there. My much smaller fiance had no such issues. No food, spa, or fitness center at the hotel, but I think that is common as well. A small price to pay for an otherwise GREAT find. We were legitly disappointed when Hurricane Irene kept us stuck in Paris for a few extra days and we couldn't go back here because they were booked...

Reviews.Title: “Great budget find in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: kurikomagirl
Reviews.Content: The staff make this place shine! all three staff members we talked to could not have been nicer or more helpful! When I'm back in Paris I would stay here again. Rooms are cute and tidy. Loved the design of the little lobby- very homey. Rooms and elevator are small but that didn't bother us. We were on a budget so adding a third bed to the deluxe twin room made the price more manageable for my two friends and I. Beds were a bit more firm than I like but fine. Nice location- we thought we might have to take the subway everywhere but actually we walked to the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens and then continued on walking to Notre Dame. One minute walk (or less!) from the Raspail Metro stop and 7 minutes walk from Denfert Rochereau where you can get the RER direct to Charles DeGaulle or a bus to Orly Airport...super convenient. We didn't opt to eat breakfast in the hotel so I can't comment on that but it was a nice option to have available. Try the nearby "Le Petit Broc" Restaurant for dinner- we had a great meal there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with attentive and smiling staff”
Reviews.Author: atame
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this hotel. It was just perfect. The hotel is just 5 minutes walk from the metro and 10 from the RER train station which brings you directly to the Airport. The location is just perfect, quite central. The room wasn´t very big, but decent in size, very clean and furnished with good taste. The bathroom was of good size, clean and in very good condition. Our room was on the 5th floor with view on the internal patio, we had no noise problems. The lift though is very small, two people maximum with not so many suitcases. The hotel personnel was very welcoming and attentive, always smiling and asking if everything was fine. Due to a later flight they kept our suitcases for basically the whole day without any problem The free Internet is a plus. For 9 € you can get standard continental breakfast which is quite good (coffee/tea, bread, one croissant and one pain au chocolat, jam and butter and fresh squeezed orange juice per person) I am very happy that I have finally found a nice hotel in Paris with excellent staff. I will surely come back. I do recommend this hotel to anyone, looking for a nice, central, at an affordable price, hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Slugette
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and loved it. The hotel is in a fantastic location as it is on the next block from Raspail metro station - which is on two lines. We could get everywhere so easily. It is also only a couple of blocks from Denfort Rochereau from where there is a regular, direct bus to Orly airport for only €6.90. We used that to arrive and depart with no hassles. The area is great with loads of restaurants, etc in the nearby streets. There are also supermarkets in the area which we used to get things for breakfast and one night for our picnic that we took to the grass in front of the Eiffel Tower! Magnificent! The cost was very reasonable. We are a family of two adults and two chidlren. We had a junior suite with a double bed, single bed and rollaway bed. Our room was so comfortable and was a great size. It even had two bathrooms! The staff were lovely. We would definately stay here again and highly recommend it for price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Alright”
Reviews.Author: somadjinn
Reviews.Content: By Paris standards, I would say the hotel was good, possibly better than most for the same price. I needed a hotel right next to the Montparnasse train station because of all my luggage and I needed to take the train without the hassle of carrying it through the metro. So I'm sure the location was a factor in the price I paid (just over 100 euro a night), and the room itself was clean, quiet, and comfortable. Very small, but that's typical in Paris, and I didn't need to run laps or anything inside my room. I guess my gripe is more with the city of Paris itself because everything is so expensive. Where I stayed the next night in Nantes (still in France), I got a room twice as large for half the price, so for any tourists interested in visiting France, it might be worth considering a side-trip somewhere maybe like Nantes, still rich with culture and sights to see, but not quite as taxing on the wallet. Coming back to this hotel, one last comment: The elevator is very small. With luggage, only expect to fit one person at a time.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: RitchieFamily2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights - two rooms side by side as we are a family of four. The rooms & bathrooms were cute, comfortable and clean. The staff was outstanding - very helpful and polite. The location was perfect as well. We took the RER from CDG with ease, used the metro everyday and walked to Montparnasse Train station to pick up a car and continue our travels in France. We would stay again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: MDOY
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in July. The room was clean and tidy, was a bit small but ok as we were not in the room much. The shower was a bit small also but quite good water flow. Air conditioning worked well and wasnt noisy. Room was relatively soundproof. Really friendly, helpful staff and they all spoke english. nice restaurants within walking distance. Metro and train station to CDG nearby. In a quiet area. Minded our luggage on our last day as we had a late flight. Cant believe its only a 2 star hotel. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, clean and quaint”
Reviews.Author: MJontheroad2011
Reviews.Content: Staff are very helpful and always wearing a smile. We were checked in promptly at noon and after we finished lunch nearby (upon recommendation by check-in staff), our luggages were already carried to our room. We have booked the chambre classique. The room is small but adequate for 2 pieces of luggage. We hauled our extra hand luggage on top of the wardrobe due to lack of space. The wardrobe could use a bit of work though as it looked a little aged and unstable. The room is quiet facing the courtyard side. We did not hear our neighbours, except in the morning and at night when people go in and come back by the stairs. Even then, it is bearable. Bathroom is clean and shower is powerful enough. The only downside is that one would feel a little cramped inside. Transportation is easy as hotel is just steps away from Raspail station. A number of boulangeries are nearby so it is easy to grab breakfast (especially good for us as we never wake up early enough for breakfast). It is also near many restaurants, one of which is La Coupole which is a super huge restaurant the size of a food court! A little surprised that this is classed as a 2 star only. This is probably the best 2 star hotel in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, convenient location, and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: bantoo70
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel De La Paix Montparnasse during our first visit to Paris, and are so glad we did! It's in a great location - the street is fairly quiet, but there are multiple restaurants and bakeries within a couple of blocks and several metro stops nearby. The staff was friendly and very helpful, giving us tips about the best ways to get to attractions and helping us get advance tickets. Our room was very snug, which we understand is the norm for Paris, but it was cozy without being uncomfortable. The elevator is tiny, but it gets the job done! Our one concern was that our room was not as sound-proof as we would have liked. We are moderately heavy sleepers, but we were awakened by other guests coming and going. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay here and think that the benefits outweigh the one drawback!

Reviews.Title: “It would have been perfect for one, but it was still worth it for two.”
Reviews.Author: ilovetoeat86
Reviews.Content: The hotel rate is very reasonable for Paris... but you do pay for what you get in terms of the size of the room. I believe we had one of the smallest standard double rooms, I figured this because we were on the top floor where one side of the wall slopes every so slightly and based on what I saw when looking at the other rooms that were on the floors directly below us. I would say that it would have been perfect for just one person size-wise... two people it can definitely cramped even for someone who likes cozy spaces. Actually the management did us a favor by putting us on the highest floor as I requested a quiet room... and it was indeed quiet given that it was facing the busy Boulevard de Raspail. The soundproofing is good, but not perfect... but even for the most difficult of people (such as myself), it should be sufficient. I found out after I booked the room (and it was too late to exchange rooms due to lack of availability the time) that the larger rooms actually face the back of the building and would probably be quieter. It is noteworthy that the staff of the hotel are exceptionally nice and it really made the difference for our stay. It always put me in a good mood after speaking to one of them, whether it was for directions or just a simple "bonjour". I'd definitely stay at this hotel again, although I'd probably choose a larger room if my budget permitted it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, view and location”
Reviews.Author: myblueheaven21
Reviews.Content: My husband did a quick trip to Paris over 4th of July and found this hotel from hotels.com It was a lovely little spot, on a quite street in Paris. It's location, in the south eastern part of Paris, was suitable enough. The Raspail metro station was just outside of the hotel. The staff was friendly and the room was clean and comfortable. About 0.1 mi down the street by the metro station was a quaint grocery store to purchase snacks, fruit, and water to prepare for a day of trekking the city. If I was to go to Paris again, I'd probably stay closer to the Notre Dame area....it has more shopping!

Reviews.Title: “We Loved our Stay”
Reviews.Author: geminitraveller
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay in this hotel for 8 nights. The location is great since it's near dining places, the Montparnasse train station and most importantly very near (1 minute walk) to a metro station (Raspail) where you can connect to other lines to go anywhere in Paris. The room we had was quite small, even the bathroom, but since we rarely stayed in the room except to sleep, we didn't mind it very much. What is important is it's clean and we can sleep comfortably on the bed after all the tiring days. The elevator is also very small. The front desk staff are all very helpful. We always ask for advise on the places we go and they give us accurate informations. Had a problem one time and had to fax something and they faxed a letter for us. They even helped us cancel one of our bookings when I can't access the proper website for an accommodation. I'm really impressed. I'm recommending this hotel to my friends visiting Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Bien”
Reviews.Author: HalBoston
Reviews.Content: Great location in Montparnasse - near the Versailles Gardens- a must to escape the tourist bustle-Take the buses- good way to see Paris

Reviews.Title: “You Won't Be Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: shellby_11
Reviews.Content: With the usual Paris accommodation availability at a premimum we booked this hotel through an online agent the day before without reading any reviews so with no reconceived ideas were pleased to be checked in by the friendly receptionist who was expecting us. The room while small was super clean and quiet and fully functioning aircon in the room was a bonus with the Paris heat. There are lots of good restaurants & bars within a few minutes walk of the hotel. As a one night stopover for us this hotel ticked all the boxes and wouldnt hesitate staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lori1016
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de la Paix Montparnasse for 9 nights during a recent trip to Paris and loved it. The hotel is adorable and is conveniently located near two Metro stops and the RER line B. There were lots of great restaurants close by on the Blvd. Montparnasse and it was an easy walk to the Luxembourg Gardens. The staff members at the front desk were always helpful and friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TiaMaria01
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a fairly busy boulevard, but it's nicely tree lined and with the double glazed windows closed, you couldn't hear any traffic at all. The window blinds were excellent too, if you need to sleep in a completely dark room. The rooms are small, but well equipped, with a simple, unfussy, but slightly quirky decor. It was spotlessly clean and the shower was pretty good and not too small. We had one breakfast there which was fine, but after that moved up to La Coupole near to the Vavin metro - their croissants, coffee and freshly squeezed fruit juices were excellent! There's a handy boulangerie just up the road and a supermarket round the corner. The hop on hop off bus (L'Open) stops right next to the Raspail Metro which is 30 seconds away. The hotel staff were really friendly and helpful and the 'bar' (basically a drinks trolley and a sofa!) was a comfy place to sit and chat after an evening out. We would definitely stay here again - the location is excellent. Lots of great restaurants close by (Chez Marcel especially) and the Tour Montparnasse is a 5 min walk - worth going up to the top for a fabulous view of Paris and the Tour Eiffel. The Cemeterie Montparnasse and Jardin du Luxembourg are both close by and nice places for a peaceful stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: atstpier
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel De La Paix. We had four (kids 11, 13) in our room in a junior suite. We had plenty of room (2 baths!). The hotel is clean and charming in a great location close to the metro. Highly recommend. The bakery down the street is great for breakfast or lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: george45
Reviews.Content: Booked based on reviews on Tripadvisor and weren't disppointed. Located conveniently to bistros/restaurants and the Metro Station Raspail which connected easily to the Eiffel Tower. Hotel room was clean. Small as expected when in Paris but adequate for our needs. The only drawback was the tiniest of lifts usual for this size Hotel. Staff were friendly and very helpful with good command of English.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaySees
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel! Because this was my first trip to Paris, at first I was concerned about being a little outside the center of the city, but it ended up being perfectly situated in an area with plenty of cafes and bars, and within a one minute walk to the Metro. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The room is small, as expected, but well equipped. The only only con is that the breakfast is not worth the 9 euro charge. It was fine - coffee, croissants and juice - but there is a crepe street vendor right around the corner or a bakery down the street that had more to offer for less money. I found this hotel to be a gem, and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: bluegoldhighlander
Reviews.Content: As with most Paris hotels the rooms here are quite cosy, but very comfortable. We booked online through one of the booking services and got a good deal. We wanted something close to the Montparmasse train station and this fit the bill. Our room faced away from the rood so while you have no view of anything, it does make it quieter. The bed was comfy and the bathroom adequate although the shower stall was almost too small for my husband to fit into. The water pressure was good with plenty of hot water. Check in was very easy, the front desk staff were friendly and spoke very good English. We were shown straight to our room with no problems. We had the breakfast in the dining area the next morning, which is unfortunately too small for the number of guests using it. The continental breakfast was very nice. The hotel was in a good location with plenty of restaurants within walking distance, and close to the train station. Nice hotel for a short stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic deal in a great location”
Reviews.Author: flaneur530
Reviews.Content: I booked the least expensive room. As expected, the room was small, but it was clean, quiet and had a modern private bathroom. The room had free WiFi, and air conditioning. The hotel staff was friendly and knowledgeable. This hotel is a small two star hotel, but it offers features not found in more expensive hotels. It is close to both the Paris Metro and the RER. I definitely plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Paris Hotel, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: italygirlSeattle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the Montparnasse area. From CDG you can take the RER B and then walk or transfer to the Metro 4 or 6 which brings you within half a block. Very convenient. The neighborhood is nice with a multitude of cafes, bakeries within walking distance. It was the perfect place to stay for a couple of nights before we took the train south to Bordeaux. It is 10 minutes walking to Gare Montparnasse. It is also 10 minutes walk to Luxembourg Gardens. This area is less touristy and a better price than the 7th where we have stayed before. This hotel has been recently remodeled. The rooms are small - basically just the bed-but they are clean and comfortable. Nice shower with good water pressure. Free Wifi in your room. Completely quiet at night. Breakfast is juice, coffee and croissants which were good - you can also walk to a cafe and get the same or more substantial breakfast if you want. For $115 euro a night - we will make this our Paris base next time also!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Londoner98
Reviews.Content: It's a modern yet quaint looking hotel. Clean and quiet, air con and all you would need in a hotel. Will you believe it's only a 2 star? Perfect location to visit Paris. The staff is young and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: psarmento
Reviews.Content: Small rooms but very well decorated! Nice service. Ask for a drink in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KRFROMSANDIEGO
Reviews.Content: The reviews for this hotel were spot on. The hotel room is small, but has everything you need. The room was clean and bed comfortable and I had a small LCD TV which was good at night to relax to. The bathroom was small as mentioned, but offered everything you needed. The service at the front desk and location of the hotel were the keys for me. Ask any question and they will pull a map out and tell you exactly where to go and how to ge there as well as offer places to eat etcc. The hotel area is nice and quiet so at night I got a good night's sleep and I was able to walk all over Paris. There are plenty of places to eat around the hotel and pretty much everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing first stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: j_nine13
Reviews.Content: My sister & I just returned from a two week trip to Europe and we stayed at Hotel de la Paix at the beginning and end of our trip (total of 3 nights). I had first read about this hotel in Budget Travel magazine as it being one of 5 ‘secret’ hotels in Paris. The article sounding promising and the other reviews on here were great so we booked it and it did not disappoint. Yes, the rooms and elevator is small but you are in Paris and should not be spending any significant amount of time in your room! The staff members that we encountered were all extremely helpful and multi-lingual. I speak very little French so their knowledge of English made it so much easier to communicate in regards to nearby banks and info about the sights of Paris. The rooms were great – they were very clean and had just about everything that you could need (a/c, extra pillows & blankets, a desk & chair, a safe, hair dryer, etc.). We stayed in room 15 & 53. They both had two twin beds but we liked 53 the best. It seemed a bit bigger and was on the very top floor so the views out the window of the streets of Paris were great. The location is great - really central to everything. Some things are in very close walking distance (Jardin de Luxembourg & the Catacombs) but the other big sights are easily accessible via short metro rides. It is a few blocks from Montparnasse Blvd which is full of cafes, shops & restaurants. The Raspail metro stop is literally steps from the hotel and 2 lines connect there – one that takes you to the Eiffel Tower area and the other to the Louvre/Notre Dame area. The Port Royal RER stop is less than a 10 minute walk from the hotel – we took this line directly from the CDG Airport and it was by far the cheapest option to get there - 18 euro for two people. Also less than a 10 minute walk is the Gare Montparnasse train station – from there you can take the TGV to practically anywhere in Europe. I cannot comment on the breakfast as we chose not to eat at the hotel but instead spent far less than 9 euros at the extremely close by patisseries. Also if you go left out of the hotel down Raspail Blvd. and then left on Rue de Campange there is a small grocery about half way down Rue de Campagne that has a little bit of everything to make a meal (we highly suggest getting some cheese, bread & wine and heading to a park/garden with it!) I'm not sure when I'll be back to Paris (but I'm now hooked and know I must return!) but I would love to stay here again and highly recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Jilly1970
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for easy walking access to countless restaurants in Montparnasse. Less than 1 minute walk to Raspail Metro station gives access to lines going north/south and east/west - you're very quickly at all the key sights. Rooms are small but very pleasant, having air con in the Paris springtime (and summer) was essential. My only small quibble would be that the shower cubicle could have been a bit cleaner but it by no means was dirty. If you don't like traffic noise it might be best to ask for a courtyard side room (you may need to pay more for it). Breakfast was fairly good value (by Parisian standards) at 9 euros for simple continental. Staff were very friendly and couldn't have been more helpful with tips on restaurants, attractions etc. I would certainly recommend this hotel as a very good value option in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Made our Paris trip wonderful”
Reviews.Author: arpy8
Reviews.Content: I went for vacation with my brother and parents, who were visiting Paris for 1st time. After seeing recommendation in Budget Travel, I booked this hotel on their Web site, getting a great "internet-special" deal. We got the "deluxe" rooms, which were a decent size for Paris. Plus: very comfortable beds in newly renovated rooms, A/C, great water pressure and hot, BBC and CNN in English. Wonderful staff were VERY friendly and helpful. Very close to Raspail metro. Lots of nice cafes in area with good food. Also Hop-on/Hop-off tour bus stop within a block. (Great way to travel and sight-see with older travelers.) Quiet area but still very convenient to sights. Near the excellent Luxembourg Park. Drawbacks (minor): small elevator (typical for Paris), which stops between floors, so you have to take a few stairs to and from room. Breakfast is okay and convenient, but Le Petit Broc has great breakfast 1/2 block away. Rotonde Cafe does too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the money”
Reviews.Author: JayB72
Reviews.Content: If you want a nice room in a convenient location for a reasonable price then I doubt you'll do better than the Hotel De La Paix. The rooms are small, which I understand is usual for Paris, but beautifully furnished and upholstered. The shower room is well appointed with a powerful shower, a large sink and mirror and a hair-dryer. A large flat-screen television has numerous French language channels and CNN in English. Rooms are serviced daily. The Hotel is on a main road, but double glazing and a pull down outside shutter keeps out traffic noise. Our only niggle was that there were no tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms. I don't know if this is usual for Paris or a particular quirk in this hotel. The hotel offers breakfast, but we chose to go our own way buying croissants and pain au chocolat from the bakery just a couple of doors down. There are also cafés directly across the street. Turn left out of the hotel, walk just 50 yards and you're at Raspail Metro station that is serviced by two lines. Line 4 will take you in to the heart of Paris (Cité, Châtelet) and on to the Gare Du Nord where you can catch a GNER to the airport or a Eurostar train. Line 6 takes you directly to the Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triomphe. Turn right out of the hotel, walk 100 yards and you're on Boulevard du Montparnasse stuffed full of restaurants, cafés and bars. All the reception staff seemed to speak English and on checking out they asked if we'd like to leave our bags with them so we could spend our last day sightseeing unhindered by luggage. We had an excellent 3 night stay and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place”
Reviews.Author: dave2566
Reviews.Content: The wife and I stayed at de la Paix for three nights this last weekend. As far as we were concerned it is a very charming hotel and were happy with our stay. We are pretty modest folks so we don't need a very fancy room to enjoy ourselves so de la Paix worked great for us. With that being said we have stayed in very upscale places previously so we know both ends of the spectrum. Yes, our room was small, but we didnt come to Paris to hang out in the room all the time. Overall the room was clean, the staff friendly and helpful, and the location was great in relation to cafes and transportation, but in a quiet and seemingly safe area. If you want a simple, nice place to stay give this one a try.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Hotel de la Paix - Montparnasse!”
Reviews.Author: 3smith
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this beautifully decorated hotel for four nights. The staff could not have been nicer during our entire visit. From helping us with maps, to letting us drop our bags (and delivering them to our room while we were exploring), to our breakfast service each morning - terrific! Great location, extremely quiet, and perfectly charming - a great hotel with wonderful people. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the most part!”
Reviews.Author: loloa312Austin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very charming and sweet! The decor was cute and the value was great for what you got! While not a four seasons, when I travel to Europe I am rarely in the hotel room anyway! The staff was very pleasant and helpful for the most part! There was one women who became very frusturated when we asked her to remove a breakfast from the bill that was not ordered. But I will pretend like that didn't happen as all the other experiences with staff was SUPER friendly! The hotel location was about 15/20 minutes walking distance to the St. Germain de Pris area with lots of little shops and cafes along the way! The subway stop was directly across the street! Great area. I would reommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “(Very) Small charming hotel in a not so crowded area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: kho777
Reviews.Content: Paris being our last stop in mainland Europe before going back to London and then Australia, we did not expect that much from this hotel, but also because we know that we would not be staying much in the hotel anyway because of the enormous amount of tourist attractions in Paris. Upon arrival in Raspail metro station (the closest metro station to the hotel), we were greeted by stairs from the platform to the street level (which seems to be the case for 95% of all metro stations in Paris after going to several metro stations in Paris). Panting, before entering the hotel front door, there was a another ledge which requires us to lift our heavy baggage (and an already sweating me) from the sidewalk to the hotel. Not happy. Can they at least build a "wheel friendly" entrance in front of their lobby door? Anyway, the young receptionist who checked us in was very friendly and more than happy to point out tourist attractions that we should not miss apart from the obvious ones. The receptionist at night, booked us for a place at Moulin Rouge as well which is a very nice gesture although we could've booked it ourselves. Wifi is free as well, but they have to give you a username and password for each device to login to the wifi. However, if you're using a Blackberry, you might not be able to login because my wife's Blackberry seems to unable to resolve the login page and therefore, unable to enter the username and password. I'm using an iPhone 4 and I could login fine to the wifi. Moving on, the elevator is the smallest I have seen in my entire life. Probably 1 meter X 1 metre. The sign says that it can fit 3 people, but I very much doubt that. Because of our luggage, only one of us can get in to the elevator and the other had to walk up the stairs. Upon arrival at our floor, you're greeted with (surprise!) another set of stairs. Apparently, the elevator is meant to stop midway between floors (which explains why the buttons have 1/2, 2/3, 3/4 on it instead of just 1, 2, 3, 4). Therefore, had to carry our baggage down the stairs again by an already sweating and tired me. The room was very small, but not too small with all working facilities (i.e TV, safe). A bit tricky on how to use the outside shades but ask the receptionist if you can't figure out how to operate this (it took me 10 minutes to figure it out). Bed was comfy, toilet was clean but very small (especially the shower) but I have no problem with this because of my not so big build. Moreover, for me, cleanliness trumps size every time in regards to hotel bathrooms. Breakfast is available for 9 euros per person although at the end, we didn't take this option. Overall, a very nice stay out of the hustle and bustle of central Paris, close to Metro and friendly staff. Merci beaucoup, Hotel De La Paix

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but...”
Reviews.Author: meistereckhart
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not bad located and apparently looks nice. But normal rooms are really very very small, and one day we did not get hot water in the morning. They told us, the boiler has a certain quantity of hot water, so when the hotel is full, it can finish! And you pay 95 Euro per night... Moreover, the woman at the desk in the morning wasn´t really believing us... you tell me if that´s normal... Apart from the that, rooms are clean and very silent. You can get a good sleep. And the person staying at the desk at night is really very very kind. He helped us a lot because we needed to print a file.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, welcoming, sweet hotel”
Reviews.Author: janellasun
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We planned to stay three nights and ended up spending seven, thanks to a snowstorm that delayed our flight home. The room was small but spotless and very comfortable, and the hotel staff were without exception warm, friendly, and helpful. The hotel is near some nice quiet neighborhoods, as well as the big brasseries on Boulevard Montparnasse. We will definitely return on our next trip to Paris. One thing to know: the elevator is very small (1-2 people max) and there are stairs that you must take to get to the rooms after you get out of the elevator -- so this would not be a good choice for people with mobility issues.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: andrewandbethan
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a pleasant but affordable hotel in Paris for a long weekend and Hotel de la Paix hit the spot. It is pretty well connected to most tourist sites with direct trains to Gare du Nord by both Metro and rapid transit (RER). The reception area has a contemporary chic setting (see pictures on website) and the staff are friendly and helpful. The main drawback is the rooms which are clean and fresh but pretty small. Didn't bother us, as we didn't go to Paris to sit in a hotel, but bear in mind if you like big hotel rooms. Breakfast wasn't included in our deal so we went across the road and paid 10 euros. Big mistake as on the next day we found almost identical places around Vavin station doing breakfast for 6 - 7 euros. The best thing about the hotel is the location in Montparnasse, slightly out of town but therefore away from the tourists and near some super neighbourhood restaurants such as Le Relais de l'Entrecote near Vavin station and Peret on Rue Daguerre (see separate reviews), both serving excellent, good value French food with friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, in a lovely city!”
Reviews.Content: If I ever go back to Paris, I will without a doubt stay at the Hotel de la paix montparnasse. I was nervous about finding a good hotel, clean, good location and afforable in Paris. I have been to Paris before and stayed in some awful hotels that cost a lot more. This hotel is great, its small, has a very cute lobby and the people working are very nice. There English isn't great, but hey you are in Paris, and they make the effort. The rooms are small, as every hotel in Europe is, but they are very clean, bright and decorated nicely. The area is great, very safe, lots of things within walking distance, and a metrostop right across the street. If you are a nervous traveller and just wants something clean, nice and safe, definitly stay here!! You will not be let down!

Reviews.Title: “Charming small hotel with great location in the 14e”
Reviews.Author: Gordon2112
Reviews.Content: This hotel worked out well for a weekend break in Paris. We know the city reasonably well, and often base ourselves in Montparnasse area due to its good selection of restaurants and shops and the ease of getting to/from CDG on the RER (get off at nearby Port Royal RER station). The hotel is very nicely decorated and has anb attractive small lounge/breakfast area on the ground floor. The lift to the upper floors is extremely small (having been built into an existing staircase), so you could easily feel like a rescued Chilean miner by the time you reach your room! Our room was also very small, even by Parisien standards, but for a weekend as a place to sleep it was fine. Just don't bring much luggage with you. We did however like the flatscreen TV with some satellite channels, the free WI-FI and the general standard of decor in the room was very good. The bathroom was also very clean. The hotel advertises A/C in all rooms, however this was deactivated during our stay in October, so we were forced to open the window and were therefore a bit disturbed by the noise from the street, but as this is "the norm" for Paris we did not feel it was appropriate to make a specific complaint. We had breakfast on one morning only - at 9 Euro for a continental breakfast it is fairly reasonable although you could get the same in any of the many cafe's in the area. The best thing about the hotel though is the fabulous location in the heart of Montparnasse, where you are literally a stone's through from some wonderful restaurants, severla metro stations (on different lines) and the Jardin de Luxembourg.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendable”
Reviews.Author: mariashem
Reviews.Content: The location was great - a metro station was just a few steps from the hotel and nearby (within very close walking distance) were the Gare Montparnasse as well as RER serving stations, taking you directly to the airport. The room was very clean and pretty. We stayed in the junior suite, which conveniently had two bathrooms - one of which oddly though had no door, but just a curtain. Taking into account this was probably one of the bigger rooms of the hotel, it is probably quite recommendable to opt for a superior room, in order not to be completely cramped (as even this junior suite was by no means big in size). The service at the reception was very friendly. We were able to pay our bill split according to our wishes. One morning we had breakfast at the hotel, which breakfast was completely fine, standard French breakfast. The other days we, however, tried some cafés nearby for variety. The area is also very clean and safe, with lots of nice cafés, brasseries and restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great little hotel! and so affordable”
Reviews.Author: gastrotravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on a stop over in Paris. From the time of reservation to checking out it was all good! Maher was exceptionally helpful. The hotel is decorated in a great style that makes you feel at home. The room was very functional and of an good size considering it is a city centre hotel. Our room has air conditioning but the windows also opened for fresh air. Free wifi was available and the breakfast in the morning was just continental but then what would you want in Paris/France. Croissant, chocolate bread, coffee/tea, fresh squeeze orange juice and baguettes. all good.

Reviews.Title: “What a perfect Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_with_son
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel De La Paix for 3 nights. It was exactly my kind of hotel! Small, cozy, charming, friendly, convenient, and SAFE! It is a quick subway ride or a long walk to anything you could want to see. I would typically walk to the sights (Notre Dame, Eiffel Tower, etc.) and then train it back. The train station is just a few yards away. There were also tons of restaurants and cafes near by when we wanted to come home and have dinner after a long day. I never had the breakfast but instead went to the grocery store around the corner and loaded up on waters, croissants and some fruit for the days activities. Much nicer to eat breakfast under the Eiffel Tower or in one of the beautiful parks. Really, this hotel is a gem in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reuben R
Reviews.Content: I lived in Paris for many years, and know the city well. Whenever I go to Paris now I stay in different 2/3 star hotels hoping to find one that would become my "base". Hotel de la Paix at Montparnasse is the first hotel that I felt "yes, I always want to stay here!". It is small, charming, well located, very clean. I had requested a single room, but ended up with a double which, despite being on the main avenue was remarkably quiet and very spacious, especially by Parisian standards. The beds are very comfortable ; the bathroom is tiny but that's a minor issue compared to the overall comfort of this hotel. Ok, the free wifi is great .... if it works... which is very much up for debate (no signal in my room, very poor signal in the reception area) and breakfast is considerably overcharged (true in most hotels). But I am booked to stay there again and hopefully I will enjoy it as much the second time. Home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelight43
Reviews.Content: Spend some time in and around Montparnasse - quieter boulevards and you get to eat where the French eat, not in the tourist traps.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic cheap 2 *hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lesley6CO
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and I have to say it exceeded all our expectations. It is in a great location, metros for line 4(gare de nord) and 12 within a 5 min walk. Loads of places to eat and drink. and only 25mins walk to Seine through the Luxemburgh gardens or the very nice area of St Germaine. The hotel is lovely, it was much nicer than we expected for the price and compared to other 2*hotels in paris. The room was clean and nicely decorated .It was small but we knew this would be the case. We had a standard room facing the back, which was lovely and quiet. There are superior rooms which may be bigger. There is a small lift too. The breakfast was 9 euros and consisted of a pot of coffee/tea, fruit juice,croissant, baguette and pain au chocolat with butter/jams. We thought it to be good value compared to what cafes were charging. Great find and would most definitely return and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable room within walking distance of city center”
Reviews.Author: Glitch58
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights in early April at the Hotel de la Paix, Montparnasse, on Raspail Blvd. I arrived several hours early, but was immediately checked-in. The desk people were attentive and helpful, spoke English and humored my minimal attempts at French nicely. The room itself was a small, immaculately clean room with a double bed and shower on the third floor facing Raspail Blvd. Though facing the street, it was very sound-proofed and the bits of traffic below were completely inaudible with the windows closed. An internet access code was provided, and an LCD television with European cable (mostly in French, with BBC Entertainment and CNN World as the only English stations). A Metro stop was within a dozen yards of the hotel entrance. Tour Montparnasse was a ten minute walk from the hotel. Overall, I found the hotel to be a good place. Everything worked well and the proximity to the more touristy areas was easily walkable ( note-- I am a person who enjoys walking) with the Louvre about a 20 minute hike and the Tour Eiffel about 30 -40 minutes away. There were a couple of small brasseries within two minutes of the hotel entrance, and many more up Raspail Blvd toward Montparnasse Blvd. This was a good place to stay. It does not have the frills and ambience of a more expensive hotel, but it is very comfortable in every way, and the staff was amicable, and helpful, knowing my name and room number whenever I came in, whether or not we had met before. I enjoyed my stay and would recommend this as a reasonable, yet inexpensive city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room, but clean and quiet...”
Reviews.Author: SneakyTravelKitty
Reviews.Content: Looking for a hotel in Paris while on a budget is a nightmare, so Hotel De La Paix M was a good 3-night stay considering its price, location and value. The hotel is located in Montparnasse area, 2 minute walk from Raspail Metro station (Metro line 4). Check in time for hotel is 1-2pm, we were given a room on 6th floor the moment we arrived. I understand that Paris does not have that much living space, but this room was Very Small! It was not more than 8-9 square meters - including the bathroom space. We were too tired to go complain at the front desk, plus based on the building format (tall and narrow) it did not look like the hotel had any larger rooms. We had to move some furniture in the room to make space for our suitcases. Valuewise, the hotel is clean and charming, staff is very friendly, everything worked properly (although we did not find the phone in our room). If you are claustrophobic, do not use the tiny elevator the hotel offers. Showering was a struggle as the shower was just too small. I was ok, but my boyfriend is wide shouldered and muscular - I cannot even imagine how he fit in there. The double bed was a bit rough, pillows were tiny. Our room was facing the street, so it could get quite loud sometimes. We recommend closing the window as night, - morning traffic will disrupt your sleep. The hotel offers a 9Euro/person breakfast, which consists of coffee, juice, 2 fresh croissants, few baguettes, butter and jam. You would find the same deal outside, so it is reasonable for Paris. The hotel does have a pretty good location. It will take you 20 minutes to get to Latin Quarter, 30 min to Notre Dame, 40 min to Louvre. Or use Paris's incredible Metro system, using which you can get anywhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Schug
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night stay at this 2 star hotel. Excellent value, friendly , helpful staff. Metro right next to hotel. Within walking distance of numerous good value restaurants as well as upmarket oyster bars. Breakfast available in hotel or go out to La Coupole for breakfast treat. Easy walk to Jardin du Luxembourg and on to several museums.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel De La Paix Montparnasse
